books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.description: A novel about the serious issues of rape and racial inequality, told through the eyes of young Scout Finch in the 1930s American South.
books.short_description: A gripping tale of racial injustice in the Deep South.

books.author: George Orwell
books.description: A chilling depiction of a totalitarian regime where the Party exercises complete control over its citizens, and surveillance is constant.
books.short_description: A dystopian novel about surveillance and totalitarianism.

books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.description: A story of the young and mysterious millionaire Jay Gatsby and his quixotic passion for the beautiful Daisy Buchanan in the Roaring Twenties.
books.short_description: A tragic romance set in the Roaring Twenties.

books.title: Moby Dick
books.author: Herman Melville
books.description: The narrative of Captain Ahab's obsessive quest to seek revenge on the gigantic white whale that crippled him.
books.short_description: An epic sea adventure and the quest for revenge.

books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.author: Jane Austen
books.description: A romantic novel that highlights the issues of class, marriage, and morality in 19th century England through the story of Elizabeth Bennet and Mr. Darcy.
books.short_description: A witty romance in 19th century England.
